intro: Guajava pohliana, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, with smooth, reddish bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into red, fleshy berries. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
